member.name: M:Syroot.BinaryData.BinaryStream.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying stream.

member.name: M:Syroot.BinaryData.BinaryStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the underlying stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the underlying stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the underlying stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the underlying stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:Syroot.BinaryData.BinaryStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the position within the underlying stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the underlying stream.

member.name: M:Syroot.BinaryData.BinaryStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the underlying stream.
member.param: The desired length of the underlying stream in bytes.

member.name: M:Syroot.BinaryData.BinaryStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the underlying stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the underlying stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the underlying stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the underlying stream.

member.summary: Indicates big endian byte order.

member.name: F:Syroot.BinaryData.Endian.Little
member.summary: Indicates little endian byte order.

member.name: T:Syroot.BinaryData.BooleanCoding
member.summary: Represents the set of formats of binary boolean encodings.

member.name: F:Syroot.BinaryData.BooleanCoding.Byte
member.summary: The boolean is stored in 1 byte and is true when the value is not 0. This is the .NET default.

member.name: F:Syroot.BinaryData.BooleanCoding.Word
member.summary: The boolean is stored in 2 bytes and is true when the value is not 0.

member.name: F:Syroot.BinaryData.BooleanCoding.Dword
member.summary: The boolean is stored in 4 bytes and is true when the value is not 0.

member.name: T:Syroot.BinaryData.DateTimeCoding
member.summary: Represents the set of formats of binary date and time encodings.

member.name: F:Syroot.BinaryData.DateTimeCoding.NetTicks
member.summary: The is stored as the ticks of a .NET instance.

member.name: F:Syroot.BinaryData.DateTimeCoding.CTime
member.summary: The has the 32-bit time_t format of the C library. This is a which can store the seconds from 1970-01-01 until approx. 2106-02-07.

member.name: F:Syroot.BinaryData.DateTimeCoding.CTime64
member.summary: The has the 64-bit time_t format of the C library. This is an which can store the seconds from 1970-01-01 until approx. 292277026596-12-04.

member.name: T:Syroot.BinaryData.StringCoding
member.summary: Represents formats of binary string encodings.

member.name: F:Syroot.BinaryData.StringCoding.VariableByteCount
member.summary: The string has a prefix of a 7-bit encoded integer of variable size determining the number of bytes out of which the string consists and no postfix. This is the .NET and default.

member.name: F:Syroot.BinaryData.StringCoding.ByteCharCount
member.summary: The string has a prefix of 1 byte determining the number of chars out of which the string consists and no postfix.

member.name: F:Syroot.BinaryData.StringCoding.Int16CharCount
member.summary: The string has a prefix of 2 bytes determining the number of chars out of which the string consists and no postfix.

member.name: F:Syroot.BinaryData.StringCoding.Int32CharCount
member.summary: The string has a prefix of 4 bytes determining number of chars out of which the string consists and no postfix.

member.name: F:Syroot.BinaryData.StringCoding.ZeroTerminated
member.summary: The string has no prefix and is terminated with a 0 value. The size of this value depends on the encoding.

member.name: F:Syroot.BinaryData.StringCoding.Raw
member.summary: The string has neither prefix nor postfix. This format is only valid for writing strings. For reading strings, the length has to be specified manually.
